From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To clear the terminal screen before displaying a menu, use the **menu clear-screen** command in global configuration mode.

ParaDef.Info: Name of the menu this command should be applied to.

Examples: In the following example, the terminal screen is cleared before displaying the menu named Access1:
ExtraInfo: This command uses a terminal-independent mechanism based on termcap entries defined in the router and the configured terminal type for the user. This command allows the same menu to be used on multiple types of terminals instead of having terminal-specific strings embedded within menu titles. If the termcap entry does not contain a clear string, the menu system enters 24 new lines, causing all existing text to scroll off the top of the terminal screen.
